item.title: TIL debugging Rails migrations
item.description: Notes If using references, the table you are referring to must already exists. You can debug migrations errors by looking at the issued statements in the logs. add_index, add_foreign_key are more flexible than t.references and its foreign_key option. .. but why? Docs https://api.rubyonrails.org/v4.2.8/ Docs https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.6/en/alter-table.html

item.title: Argument Hash for a String#scan
item.description: Check how this person used scan on a hash values https://exercism.io/tracks/ruby/exercises/scrabble-score/solutions/14220b7319e643d4990f38875830a2a5

item.title: TIL percentage encoding in ruby
item.description: Motivation Document what options exist in Ruby whenever in I want to do Percent-Encoding. What is Percent Encoding? A. K. A. URL encoding. Used to create URIs (both URLs and URNs). Used to prepare data of the application/x-www-form-urlencoded media type. There is a reserved character set: !*'();:@&=+$,/?#[] What do we have in the Ruby library? References -URI.escape vs CGI::escape
